results.title: Aesop's fables. Volume 2
results.brief_description: Presented by Noni Hazelhurst, each of the Aesops fables (stories designed to teach a moral lesson) is brought to life by the use of beautifully illustrated full colour drawings of both the characters and their environment. The 18 stories on this tape are short and to the point. The tapes primary intent is to instruct rather than entertain, and short interludes between each story may be used by the teacher to generate discussion with the students on the stories they have just seen and heard. Fables include: The Shepherd boy and the Wolf ; The Fox and the grapes ; The Hare and the Tortoise ; The Cat and the Mouse ; The Hare and the Hound ; The Raven and the Swan and The lion, the ass and the fox.

results.title: Aerobics Down Under-Beginners
results.creator_credit: University of Western Australia and University of Western Australia. Human Movement and Recreation Studies Department
results.brief_description: The 30 minute “Beginners” program is at a gently demanding pace and is suitable for anyone who has not been actively involved in an exercise program within the past three months. Rated: G
results.creator_credit_for_label: University of Western Australia and University of Western Australia. Human Movement and Recreation Studies Department

results.title: Aerobics Down Under-Advanced
results.creator_credit: University of Western Australia and University of Western Australia. Human Movement and Recreation Studies Department
results.brief_description: For people seeking a high level of fitness, the 50 minute advanced tape offers a stimulating challenge. The exercises involved are complex, very demanding and require agility, flexibility, co-ordination and good aerobic fitness. Under no circumstances should this program be attempted before a suitable fitness level has been achieved with a thorough and regular fitness building program. The advanced program will not be attainable by all age groups; older exercisers will find the first two programs more suited to their requirements. Rated: G
results.creator_credit_for_label: University of Western Australia and University of Western Australia. Human Movement and Recreation Studies Department

results.title: Adventures of Captain Africa: mighty jungle avenger. Vol. 2
results.creator_credit: Spencer Bennet, Sam Katzman and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Captain Africa helps the Arabian caliph Hamid to regain his throne which has been stolen from him by a rival. Aided by adventurer Ted Arnold, hunter Nat Coleman, his assistant Omar and Arabian princess Rhoda, Captain Africa battles wild animals, the usurper’s army and a pair of white adventurers. For some reason this movie serial was banned in Finland. Cast includes John Hart, Rick Vallin, Ben Welden, June Howard, Bud Osborne, Paul Marion, Lee Roberts.

results.title: Adventures
results.creator_credit: Michael Rubbo, Nicholas Balla and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The story of a little raccoon who encounters many adventures when he strays from home to explore the world around him. The raccoon and all the other creatures in the film are real but are given voices by a little girl and her father. The situations are all natural and amusing. Suitable for very young children.

results.title: Advancement of women in poor rural areas
results.creator_credit: Michel Regnier, Jean Dansereau, J.-P. Olivier Fougeres and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The English version of a film that was shot mainly in Bhatshala-Shapmari, in the north of Bangladesh, and at Savar and Dapashai in the center of the country. We see the efforts of teams from Gonoshasthaya Kendra to free women from poor villages from submission and misery. Through health care, education and professional courses, medical assistants and social workers allow countrywomen to benefit from their nation’s progress. Part three of the series.

results.title: Adriana Lecouvreur
results.creator_credit: Hugh Davidson, John Copley, ABC-TV (Australia) and Opera Australia
results.brief_description: Recorded live at the Sydney Opera House on 18 February 1984 this performance of Francesco Cilea’s ” Adriana Lecouvreur” features the grand voice of Dame Joan Sutherland, along with John Shaw, Anson Austin and Heather Begg, The Australian Opera Chorus and The Elizabethan Sydney Orchestra conducted by Richard Bonynge. Set in four acts, it tells the tragic story of a Parisian actress, Adriana Lecouvreur. “This is an excellently sung, played and staged production of this lovely, lyrical opera”…(The Canberra Times). Sung in Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: Adoption: children are waiting
results.creator_credit: Laurie Jennings, Lee Gordon, National Film Board of Canada and Westminster Films
results.brief_description: This film will inform and encourage prospective adopting parents and be helpful to professionals in the child-welfare field. In interviews, three couples relate their experiences of adopting older or handicapped children. A fourth couple explains how they, as foster parents, try to prepare children emotionally for adoption.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Laurie Jennings, Lee Gordon, National Film Board of Canada and Westminster Films

results.title: ADHA: attention deficit hyperactivity disorder
results.brief_description: Dr. Christopher Green, author of the famous “Toddler taming” and “Babies”, is a leading authority on Attention Deficit Disorder. This program, designed for parents, teachers and healthcare professionals, investigates key issues about the disorder. It examines ADHD in the under 5’s, school age children, and adults, as well as covering diagnosis, behaviour techniques, alternative treatment and medication.
